text: hey it's angel welcome to tip Tuesday
it's where every Tuesday I share with
you some of my fever home and kitchen
tips now you know it's been a while
since my last Tuesday video but this
week I have two practical ways that you
can close bags like these plastic bags
that you see at the grocery store all
the time and also a bag of chips without
the use of backflips or twist ties so
let's get started
technique one works on plastic fruit and
veggie bags start by twisting the top of
the bag creating a thin section next
using two fingers make a peace sign and
wrap the bag around those fingers
finally tuck the end in a loop under in
between the peace sign remove your
fingers then pull up on the loop with
one hand and pull down on the bag with
the other tightening the knot and voila
you'll have sealed your bag without
using any twist ties when you're ready
to open it it's even easier just pull on
the end with one hand while holding the
knot in place with the other see easy
technique to works on half empty chip
bags or in this case the shrimp chip bag
start by flattening the top and rolling
the top of the bag over once or twice
creating a first seal next fold the
corners of the bag in in a triangle
shape
and once that's done fold down the top
again three to four times creating a
second seal now notice the top corners
of the bag take your thumbs and put them
underneath these corners and tuck them
inside out like you're folding socks
this is the trickiest part so feel free
to make adjustments as you go once it's
tucked the bag is sealed no chip clips
needed so that's it that's how you can
seal a bag of chips or even a plastic
bag like this without the use of twist
ties or even a bag clip just your hands
so I hope you guys enjoyed this tip
Tuesday don't forget to join me next
week for another awesome kitchen tip and
I will see you guys soon bye
